description: From Middle English horribly, horribely, horribliche, horriblelyche, equivalent to horrible +â€Ž -ly.

adverbs.description: horribly (comparative more horribly, superlative most horribly)

entries.meaning: (manner) In a horrible way; very badly.
examples: The beginning art students displayed their horribly executed paintings with hopeful faces.

entries.meaning: (degree, often modifying a negative adverb or adjective) To an extreme degree or extent.
examples: The man was horribly nice, yet she still wouldn't marry him.
Horribly, as he was dying, his eyes reddened.
